intro: Goldmania foetida, commonly known as the stinking goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and aromatic, often pungent foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its unique, sometimes unpleasant odor.
